titleStmt.title: Lelah-Puc-ka-Chee and Ta-Ta-Pi-Cha v. W.G. Malin and G.N. Nellis. Letter from Petitioner's Husband

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Lelah-Puc-ka-Chee and Ta-Ta-Pi-Cha v. W.G. Malin and G.N. Nellis. Letter from Petitioner's Husband
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: United States Circuit Court in Northern District Iowa

div1.p: Copied at the National Archives at Kansas City

I Ta-Ta)Pi-Cha, being first duly sworn on oath depose and say that I am one of the petitioners-- in the above entitled matter and cause, and that I am the husband of the petitioner, Lelah-Puc-ka-Chee, that I have had carefully interpeted to me the foregoing reply and affirmative defense, That I fully know and understand the allegations and contents therein alleged, That all the said contents and allegations therein contained are each and all correct and true as I do verily believe.
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORNE TO BEFORE ME BY THE SAID Ta-Ta-Pi-Cha, this 11th day of December A,D, 1899
in and for said Tama County and State of Iowa
lur State of Iowa Tama County} SS

I Na-Wau-Kee-Kee being first duly sworn on oath deforcend say that I have had carefully interpreted to me the forgiong reply and defende that I am the matter of the petitioner Lalah-Puc-Ka-Chee That I have personal knowledge of all the facts and allegations in the foregoing reply and affirmative defense are correct and true as I do verify delieve
subscribed sworn to before me by the said Na-Wau-Kee-Kee this 11th day of December 1899 JW Larnle Volary Rublie in and for said Tama Co Iowa
